Certainly! Here are a few options for bike trails and nature walks in the Portland, Oregon area:

1. Forest Park: Located in the heart of Portland, Forest Park offers miles of trails ideal for hiking, mountain biking, and trail running. It is one of the largest urban forests in the country, encompassing over 5,200 wooded acres.

2. Eastbank Esplanade: This paved riverfront trail offers stunning views of the city and connects to the Springwater Corridor Trail. The 1.5-mile route is perfect for walking, jogging, or cycling.

3. Tryon Creek State Park: Just south of downtown Portland, Tryon Creek State Park features miles of forested trails for hikers and bicyclists. The park is home to more than 50 bird species, as well as deer, raccoons, and other wildlife.

4. Columbia River Gorge: Located just east of Portland, the Columbia River Gorge offers numerous scenic bike trails and hiking paths. The well-known 13-mile Historic Columbia River Highway State Trail is a must-visit option.

I hope this helps!
